ACT
206
Proclamation of an oral will
If the testator made an oral will, and there is a document signed by the witnesses, the court will declare the contents of that document according to the provisions that apply to the declaration of a written will.
If there is no document from paragraph 1 of this article, the court will hear separately the witnesses in front of whom the oral will was declared, and in particular about the circumstances on which its validity depends, so the record of the hearing of those witnesses will be promulgated according to the provisions that apply to promulgation written wills.
If the party demands that the witnesses of the oral will be heard under oath, or if the court determines that such a hearing is necessary, it will set a hearing for the hearing of these witnesses to which it will invite the proposer and other interested persons only if this would not prolong the proceedings.
